thread.title: Immigration officials detail the 41 people rounded up in raids
thread.title_full: Immigration officials detail the 41 people rounded up in raids

author: RICH SCHAPIRO
title: Immigration officials detail the 41 people rounded up in raids
text:
Immigration officials give details on the 41 people rounded up in raids, most of whom are criminals Immigration officials detail the 41 people rounded up in raids In all, 38 had previous convictions, two were fugitives with final orders of removal and one had re-entered the country after already being deported, according to ICE. (CHARLES REED/AFP/Getty Images)  02 PM 
A dozen of the 41 undocumented immigrants swept up in federal raids in the city last week had prior convictions for rape or sex offense, sources said Friday. 
More than half of those arrested by agents from the U.S.   had previous convictions for major crimes such as rape, assault, robbery and drug sales. 
Some 10 others had been convicted of driving under the influence — and the rest had convictions for crimes such as police obstruction and invasion of privacy, sources said. 
In all, 38 had prior convictions, two were fugitives with final orders of removal and one had re-entered the country after already being deported, sources added. 
Immigration officials announce 41 arrests in NYC amid criticism 
The new details contained only the suspects’ ages, nationalities and crimes. 
The crackdown carried out in recent days amounted to more than 680 arrests in Los Angeles, Chicago, Atlanta, San Antonio and the New York City area. 
Secretary   John Kelly, speaking earlier in the week, said the dragnet was consistent with "routine, targeted arrests” carried out by ICE . 
Advocates had said the raids rattled immigrant groups following President Trump’s controversial immigration orders signed last month. 
N.Y. Assembly OKs bill to shield immigrants 
Calls from frightened immigrants inundated Legal Aid lawyers. 
The widespread crackdown came days after a federal appeals court upheld a decision to freeze Trump's controversial immigration order denying entry to refugees and citizens from seven Muslim-majority countries. 
ICE had previously released information only on three of those arrested: 

Scammers threaten to deport Hispanic man 

An MS-13 gang member from El Salvador, convicted of assault with a dangerous weapon in aid of racketeering A Jamaican citizen, convicted of first-degree sexual assault of a victim under the age of 11 A citizen of Mexico, convicted of first-degree sexual assault of a victim under the age of 11
